column1: Smoque BBQ////We wanted to visit Smoque since seeing it on Triple D. We finally made it on a Saturday evening after a Cubs game. The wait was about 45 minutes to place our order
column2: which isn't bad considering their popularity. Once ordered we were immediately seated at a table outside and our food was ready within 15 minutes. The staff are excellent with customer service and friendly enough too. We shared sliced brisket
column7: and the peach cobbler. It all was good
column8: but I had personal preferences that stopped it from being great for me. I prefer creamy cole slaw and theirs is vinegary
column9: and the baked beans were really soupy. Glad we got to go and experience it
column10: but the general agreement is we wouldn't go out of our way to do so again.
